alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 12:42AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following county, Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated rain has moved out of the area. However, the rain on Sunday accumulated from 3 to 5 inches, resulting in flooding lingering in some areas. - Lingering issues with standing water should slowly diminish through the night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawrenceville, Lawrenceville Airport, Billett and Pinkstaff.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
